channel.title: Jekyll on htr3n's
channel.link:
https://htr3n.github.io/tags/jekyll/Recent content in Jekyll on htr3n'sHugo -- gohugo.ioenThis work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.Tue, 23 Jan 2018 00:00:00 +0000 First experience with Hugohttps://htr3n.github.io/2018/01/first-experience-with-hugo/Tue, 23 Jan 2018 00:00:00 +0000https://htr3n.github.io/2018/01/first-experience-with-hugo/

To commence my journey in software development, I have looked for a Web framework to build this blog. I have started writing blog posts mainly using (Multi)Markdown and plan to migrate other posts to Markdown too. Thus, it’s rather natural to go with built-in or first-class support for Markdown to minimise the migration effort.
